channel.title: How do i (Skillcape Need Help)
channel.description: how do i make skillcapes pop up in inventory plzzz help!

item.title: How do i (Skillcape Need Help)
item.dc:creator: @planplan planplan
item.description:
@planplan wrote:

case 0: // Attack levelup sendFrame164(6247); sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 6248); sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .", 6249); sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level."); if (playerLevel[0] == 99) { addItem(3777, 1); } else { sendMessage("you need 99 attack to wear this cape sorry come back later when you have it."); break;

item.title: How do i (Skillcape Need Help)
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

[quote=“D D 3, post:5, topic:152161”][quote author=Cryme Time link=topic=208125.msg1826282#msg1826282 date=1192588614]
Raawwgghhh… Another noob.[/quote]
No need for this.

If you mean when they get a 99 stat then you open client.java
and search for case 0:, You should see somethign that says attack lvl up under the gfx or the part that says congratulations add this

if (playerLevel[0] == 99) {
sendMessage(“Congratulations on getting Level 99 Attack!”);
addItem(3777, 1);

So the 0 is the stat and the 3777 is the item to add and the 1 is how many of the level so you can change the 0 to any of the skill numbers here is all of the skill numbers:

playerLevel[0] = Attack playerLevel[1] = Defence playerLevel[2] = Strength playerLevel[3] = Hitpoints playerLevel[4] = Range playerLevel[5] = Prayer playerLevel[6] = Magic playerLevel[7] = Cooking playerLevel[8] = WoodCutting playerLevel[9] = Fletching playerLevel[10] = Fishing playerLevel[11] = Firemaking playerLevel[12] = Crafting playerLevel[13] = Smithing playerLevel[14] = Mining playerLevel[15] = Herblore playerLevel[16] = Agility playerLevel[17] = Thieving playerLevel[18] = Slayer playerLevel[19] = Farming playerLevel[20] = Runecrafting[/quote]
nice, but don’t tell him he will never learn if you don’t challenge him.

Read full topic

if (playerLevel[0] == 99) {

addItem(3777, 1);

So the 0 is the stat and the 3777 is the item to add and the 1 is how many of the level so you can change the 0 to any of the skill numbers here is all of the skill numbers:

playerLevel[0] = Attack playerLevel[1] = Defence playerLevel[2] = Strength playerLevel[3] = Hitpoints playerLevel[4] = Range playerLevel[5] = Prayer playerLevel[6] = Magic playerLevel[7] = Cooking playerLevel[8] = WoodCutting playerLevel[9] = Fletching playerLevel[10] = Fishing playerLevel[11] = Firemaking playerLevel[12] = Crafting playerLevel[13] = Smithing playerLevel[14] = Mining playerLevel[15] = Herblore playerLevel[16] = Agility playerLevel[17] = Thieving playerLevel[18] = Slayer playerLevel[19] = Farming playerLevel[20] = Runecrafting

item.title: How do i (Skillcape Need Help)
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

Search

case 0: // Attack levelup // sendFrame164(6247); // sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 6248); // sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .", 6249); sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level."); //NpcDialogueSend = true; break;
You need to figure out how to make it so when you hit level 99 it will add the cape. Not hard to do, it’s something like adding portal requirements if you want a hint.

Read full topic
